isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - PAINT AND REFINISHING - ORIGINAL FINISH RESTORATION

svcsubsecinfo.para: In many cases repair of the finish does not have to include repainting. To reduce customer complaints, original finish and final detailing may be necessary. The four main steps to finish restoration are filing and sanding, buffing, polishing, and protecting the finish.
Before any finish restoration, wash the vehicle to remove foreign material.

svcproc.title: FILING AND SANDING
svcproc.para: Filing and sanding removes dirt nibs, runs, and sags. A file, sanding stone, or block should be used to remove the defect. Normally, using sandpaper to remove a defect causes the area to crown. This means that the paint surface around the defect wears away before the defect. Using a file, stone, or block, the defect can be removed without excessive damage to the surrounding paint. To make a dirt nib file, refer to Figure 3.

figure.caption: Figure 3. Making a Dirt Nib File

svcproc.para: When sanding Basecoat/Clearcoat paint finish, grits coarser than 1500 should not be used.

warning.para: Failure to wear eye protection and an approved mask for sanding, buffing and machine polishing could result in personal injury.
